prompts:
/classify_issue {"number": "2", "title": "Sync GitLab main branch before creating MRs", "body": "## Problem

When creating GitLab Merge Requests from ADW workflows, if the GitLab repository's `main` branch is behind GitHub's `main`, the MR will include unrelated changes from the sync gap.

This happened in MR !1 which showed 34 files changed instead of just the workflow-generated spec file.

## Root Cause

The workflow pushes the feature branch to GitLab but doesn't ensure GitLab's `main` branch is up-to-date. When GitLab compares the feature branch against its outdated `main`, it includes all the commits that exist in GitHub but not in GitLab.

## Proposed Solution

Always make sure all `main` branch remotes are synced. We must have the complete context for Jerry before beginning any new work.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] ALWAYS Check sync status and perform a sync before starting on a task.
- [ ] `main` branch is always considered default
- [ ] Handle case where GitLab remotes and mirrors don't exist gracefully
- [ ] Log sync operation for observability

## Related

- GitHub PR #27: GitLab MR support
- MR !1 (closed): Example of the sync issue"}
